p: The best-known proteasome inhibitor is Bortezomib (Valcade) [ 50], which was approved in 2008 as a first-line drug in the treatment of multiple myeloma. Other inhibitors are MG132, Lactacistin, Carfilzomib, Ixazomib and others which are able to target the 20S and 19S subunits ( Figure 2) [ 49, 52]. Interestingly, Computational Drug Repurposing Studies showed that Carfilzomib is a good candidate for the treatment of COVID-19 [ 53].
